overview.problemStatement: The list chromatic number χL(G)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">χL(G)χL(G)\chi_L(G) is defined to be the minimal k" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">kkk such that for any assignment of a list of k" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">kkk colours to each vertex of G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG (perhaps different lists for different vertices) a colouring of each vertex by a colour on its list can be chosen such that adjacent vertices receive distinct colours. Determine the minimal number of vertices n(k)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">n(k)n(k)n(k) of a bipartite graph G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG such that χL(G)>k" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">χL(G)>kχL(G)>k\chi_L(G)>k.
